results.brief_description: Surveys Expo ‘70, showing the main buildings and events and suggesting the scope and spirit of the Fair.

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 033. Who's for tennis?
results.brief_description: Looks at the interest shown in tennis in Australia from children learning the basics of the game, to champions such as Emerson and Roche playing off in competition at the White City Courts. Fresh air, exercise and making new friends attract people to the game.

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 028. Sydney Opera House
results.brief_description: Joern Utzon’s design for the Sydney Opera House is taking form in this newsreel program. The main concert hall with a 2,800 seating capacity, various drama theatres, rehearsal rooms, restaurants and other amenities are part of this exceptional building.

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 026
results.brief_description: Sydney artists Geoff Pike and Bob Booth exhibit their paintings on a floating gallery, the “One Step”, and profits from sales are to finance further their voyage around the Pacific Islands. Also featured is the launching of the Blue Streak Rocket from Woomera, the holiday resort of Forster on the New South Wales coast with its history, scenic surroundings and facilities.

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 010
results.brief_description: Magazine items: Ancient art of the potter used in manufacture of plastic lampshades; Taree’s attractions include facilities for yachting, golf, bowls; valuable minerals such as rutile and zircon; scenery, forestry and cattle industry. No other credits available.

results.title: Australia at War 1914-1918: an Account of the Australian Force in the Great War
results.creator_credit: Barrie Pattison, Frank Bagnall, Australian War Memorial and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: This detailed account of “the war to end all wars” comprises actual footage shot on the battlefields of Europe and the Middle East. Commencing with troops leaving Australia, it documents the major battles campaigns of Australian and New Zealand troops including those in Egypt, the Somme and Cambrai in which 60,000 Australians died. Shows rare footage from the only roll of film taken at Gallipoli and includes footage from the work of Hubert Wilkins and Frank Hurley acquired from the archives of the Australian War Memorial.
results.title_for_label: Australia at War 1914-1918: an Account of the Australian Force in the Great War

results.title: Architecture: a performing art
results.creator_credit: Film Australia and Michael Robertson Film Productions
results.brief_description: An overview of the career and lifestyle of the Australian architect, John Andrews whose better known accomplishments include the CTT Tower in Toronto - the tallest free-standing structure in the world, the International Shipping Terminal at Miami, the Cameron Offices in Canberra and the American Express Tower in Sydney.

results.title: The Apprentice
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Alan Harkness and Fontana Films
results.brief_description: Answers the questions of potential apprentices and their parents about how the apprenticeship scheme works in Australian industry by concentrating on Robert, an apprentice fitter and turner with an automotive firm. Robert, his father and his supervisor give their views on the training involved, which is intended to develop a boy’s character as well as to produce a good craftsman.
